context: I made an insensitive joke at your expense
letters:
Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope this note finds you well. I’ve been reflecting on our recent conversation, and I can’t shake the feeling of regret for the insensitive joke I made. It was thoughtless and hurtful, and I want you to know how truly sorry I am.

I value our friendship deeply, and it pains me to think that I may have caused you discomfort or hurt you in any way. My intention was never to make light of something important to you, and I realize how my words fell short. I understand that what I said was not just a joke; it undermined the significance of your feelings and experiences.

Please know that I am committed to being a better friend. I appreciate your kindness, patience, and the trust we’ve built over the years. I promise to be more mindful of my words and their impact in the future.

If you’re open to it, I’d love the chance to talk more about this or anything else that’s on your mind. Thank you for considering my apology, and I hope we can move past this together.

Take care,

[Your Name]

Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I want to take a moment to sincerely apologize for the insensitive joke I made recently. Looking back, I realize that my words may have hurt you, and that was never my intention.

I value our friendship deeply, and it pains me to think that I caused you discomfort. Humor can be tricky, and I failed to consider how my comments might affect you. Please know that I am truly sorry for crossing a line and for any distress it may have caused.

I appreciate your understanding and patience as I learn from this experience. I will be more mindful in the future to ensure that our interactions are positive and supportive. Thank you for your friendship and for giving me the chance to make things right.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]
